name: Lineten
description:
NOQU Delivery is a B2B, white labelled
delivery system designed to enable
retailers to offer ultra-fast home
delivery with real-time GPS tracking
and average delivery times of one hour
for goods and 30 minutes for takeaway
food, within a flat rate charging model.
The system is underpinned by over
160,000 drivers and riders and covers
over 70% of the UK’s population

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.description:
Due to further expansion, we are seeking a Full Stack Developer to help us to continue to dominate one of the most buoyant, fastest-growing industries, that is changing the world and the speed of which we receive items.

LineTen is on a mission to crack the code on urban delivery. By leading with our values and putting carrier partners first, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. LineTen is a new approach to delivery with a free carrier API and an operations management platform for shippers. We're building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

You will be joining a passionate, highly skilled, technical team of 15, who work on 3 core products, each with their own technical frameworks, using common front-end and back-end libraries.

Throughout your career with Lineten, you will have the opportunity to work with each of these products and influencing both the technical and functional direction of them, utilising the best technologies and the best libraries to solve problems.

We are seeking forward-thinking, dynamic developers, who want to be game changers in solving real-world business problems using cutting edge technology and thinking.

As well as development through the full systems development life cycle, you will also be responsible for:

- Weekly Sprint prioritisation (we have 2 weekly Sprints)
- Participate in daily stand-ups (sprint reviews past and current)
- Weekly development meetings and 121’s
- Weekly solution design sessions
- Participate in code reviews
- Work with QA team to create test plans for new or modified functionality
- Documentation using Confluence and tasks using Jira (Atlassian software suite)
- Participate in Defining requirements, Acceptance criteria early on with product owners

**Experience in the following:**

- Extensive experience with PHP 5.6+ and knowledge of any modern frameworks (framework agnostic)
- Knowledge of angular JS, Vue JS or react JS like JavaScript frameworks
- Hands on experience with SOLID principles and design patterns
- Writing PHPunit, integration and end-to-end tests 
- Good working knowledge of Git and Composer

**We need you to be comfortable with:**

- Paired programming
- Training, guiding, helping new and existing team members
- Clear communication for expressing problems, blockers and any other matters

**Who are Lineten**

We are a leading on-demand delivery platform, which is the future of the logistics industry. We currently have 50 employees, and having just gone through Series A funding, we are now accelerating our growth world-wide. Even though we are currently small, we have an impressive list of clients such as Farfetch, Krispy Kreme and Five Guys, to name but a few.

**Perks on offer**

- Individual £2000 training budget per annum
- £100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
- Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
- Healthcare will be launched shortly
- Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
- Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
- Have a dog? we're a dog friendly office, You're more than welcome to bring yours in
- Onsite meditation/sleep room
- Onsite creche and babysitting service
- Onsite sports therapist
- Onsite games room
- Onsite free drinks every Thursday
- Discounts to local businesses services
- Opportunities to work abroad longer term

jobs.title: Enterprise Business Development Director
jobs.description:
Due to further expansion, we are seeking an Enterprise Business Development Director to help us to continue to dominate one of the most buoyant, fastest-growing industries, that is changing the world and the speed of which we receive items.

LineTen is on a mission to crack the code on last-mile delivery. By combining cutting edge SAAS technology with managed services for delivery and dispatch, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. LineTen is a new approach to delivery bundling advanced technology with managed services, we’re building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

**Role of SAAS, Enterprise Business Development Director**

As well as closing large enterprise deals across Europe, you will also be responsible for cross-selling and up-selling into your accounts.

We offer uncapped commission opportunities and there is the opportunity to double your salary as well as gain equity or stock options. For the right individual, there will be managerial opportunities to build and grow your own team.

**Responsibilities of Business Development Director**

- Managing the full sales cycle of tier 1 enterprise deals.
- Generating new business with prospective clients in global markets.
- Educating new clients on LineTen’s offering, USPs and strengths.
- Engaging with prospective customers in a consultative sales way.Establishing strong client relations and creating solutions for clients.

Skills / Experience Requirements

- 5+ years’ experience in enterprise technology sales development.
- Experience in the logistics delivery / last mile – advantage.
- Selling enterprise platforms to c-level decision makers. 
- Solid sales qualification experience, utilising a consultative mindset.
- Flexibility – ability to travel abroad.
- Fluent English – speaking and writing, additional languages a big * advantage as we expand across Europe
- Experienced in enterprise sales methodologies, working with CRM systems for reporting, forecasting and pipeline management.

**Perks on offer**

- Uncapped sales commissions
- Equity or stock options
- Individual £2000 training budget per annum
- £100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
- Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
- Healthcare will be launched within the next 3 months
- Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
- Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
- Have a dog? We’re a dog-friendly office, You're more than welcome to bring yours in 
- Onsite creche and babysitting service
- Onsite sports therapist
- Onsite games room
- Onsite free drinks every Thursday
- Discounts to local businesses services
- Opportunities to work abroad longer term

Lineten is rapidly growing and we need ambitious, driven individuals to help us disrupt the logistics industry and take us to the next level. Fast growth, means excellent career development opportunities for individuals who join us now.

Be part of something big. We're here to change things and want to make sure we develop our people along the way

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.description:
LineTen is growing; we are now seeking 2 Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) to help us continue to dominate one of the most buoyant, fast-growing industries, that is changing the world and the speed in which we receive items.

LineTen is on a mission to crack the code on last-mile delivery. By leading with our values and putting carrier partners first, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. LineTen represents a new approach to delivery with a free carrier API and an operations management platform for shippers. We're building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

We are seeking self-motivated, passionate individuals to join our growing team. This position is key to filling the top of the funnel and assisting the Sales team in closing deals with qualified prospects. You will have the opportunity to impact the bottom line by generating revenue through identifying new opportunities and to learn one of the most fascinating fast-paced industries.

You will receive in-depth coaching and training from your highly credible Sales Director as well as support from your colleagues, whilst taking advantage of our £2000pa training budget.

The team and the company are expected to double in size over the next 12 months, creating excellent career opportunity including the scope to build an SDR function or be part of the full sales life cycle.

**Responsibilities**

- Work alongside sales, marketing and leadership to execute targeted outbound prospecting.
- Market research to identify new potential customers, lead generation and qualification of these leads through independent prospecting.
- Identifying specific prospects/partners to approach and effectively communicate the specific value proposition for the customer’s business.
- Leveraging cold calling (quality not quantity), emailing, and social media to build the sales funnel.
- Build and develop relevant industry knowledge depending on geography/vertical.
- Track all client communications, coordinate meetings with sales executives and dutifully log all activities in CRM.
- Accountable for meeting or exceeding monthly qualified lead objectives and quotas.

**Requirements**

- Must demonstrate a desire to learn, embrace new concepts and be passionate about leveraging the email/phone / social networks to drive opportunity.
- Proven experience of SDR or Inbound Enterprise B2B Sales.
- Be resourceful, using your initiative and have a passion for working in an effective and self-guided manner in a fast-paced environment, with a drive for hunting, winning and providing value target prospective accounts.
- Salesforce/Hubspot experience.
- Familiarity with sales qualification frameworks.
- Understanding of generating pipeline through outbound/inbound activity, and utilizing CRM software to aide in engagement.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to identify and provide comprehensive solutions for varying partner needs.

**Perks on offer**

- Individual £2000 training budget per annum
- £100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
- Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
- Healthcare will be launched within the next 3 months
- Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
- Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
- Have a dog? We’re a dog-friendly office, You're more than welcome to bring yours in 
- Onsite meditation/sleep room
- Onsite creche and babysitting service
- Onsite sports therapist
- Onsite games room
- Onsite free drinks every Thursday
- Discounts to local businesses services
- Opportunities to work abroad longer term

Lineten is rapidly growing and we need ambitious, driven individuals to help us disrupt the logistics industry and take us to the next level. Fast growth, means excellent career development opportunities for individuals who join us now.

Be part of something big. We're here to change things and want to make sure we develop our people along the way.

jobs.title: Business Development Executive
jobs.description:
**Business Development Executive**

Due to further expansion, we are seeking a Business Development Executive, who has come from a SAAS background, to help us to continue to dominate one of the most buoyant, fastest-growing industries, that is changing the world and the speed of which we receive items.

LineTen is on a mission to crack the code on last-mile delivery. By combining cutting edge SAAS technology with managed services for delivery and dispatch, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. LineTen is a new approach to delivery bundling advanced technology with managed services, we’re building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

**Role of SAAS, Business Development Executive**

As well as closing deals, you will also be responsible for cross-selling and up-selling into your accounts. We offer uncapped commission opportunities and there is the opportunity to double your salary as well as gain equity or stock options.

We are rapidly growing the department, so for the right individual, there will be managerial opportunities to build and grow your own team.

**Responsibilities;**

- Managing the full sales cycle of tier 1 enterprise deals.
- Generating new business with prospective clients in global markets.
- Educating new clients on LineTen’s offering, USPs and strengths.
- Engaging with prospective customers in a consultative sales way.
- Establishing strong client relations and creating solutions for clients.

****Skills / Experience Requirements****

- 5+ years’ experience in enterprise technology sales development.
- Experience in the logistics delivery / last mile – advantage.
- Selling enterprise platforms to c-level decision-makers.
- Solid sales qualification experience, utiliazing a consultative mindset.
- Exceptional interpersonal communication and presentation skills.
- Flexibility – ability to travel abroad.
- Fluent English – speaking and writing
- Experienced in enterprise sales methodologies, working with CRM systems for reporting, forecasting and pipeline management.

Perks on offer

- Individual $2500 training budget per annum
- $100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)

Lineten is rapidly growing and we need ambitious, driven individuals to help us disrupt the logistics industry and take us to the next level. Fast growth, means excellent career development opportunities for individuals who join us now.

Be part of something big. We're here to change things and want to make sure we develop our people along the way

jobs.title: Technical Support Analyst
jobs.description:
Due to further expansion, we are seeking a Technical Support Analyst to help us to continue to dominate one of the most buoyant, fastest-growing industries, that is changing the world and the speed of which we receive items.

LineTen is on a mission to crack the code on urban delivery. By leading with our values and putting carrier partners first, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. LineTen is a new approach to delivery with a free carrier API and an operations management platform for shippers. We're building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

**Technical Support Analyst**

This individual will provide front-line primary technical support to end users on various technical issues and problems relating to hardware, software and peripherals. They will also be responsible for responding to, documenting and resolving service tickets in a timely manner according to SLA. The candidate must have excellent problem solving skills in order to diagnose, evaluate and resolve complex problem situations, or when appropriate, escalate or route them to appropriate IT staff members. The role also involve configuring and maintaining online ordering platforms we have built for our clients.

The role will also involve performing root cause analysis, develop checklists for typical problems and recommend procedures and controls for problem prevention. This position will support multiple bespoke applications developed in-house by Lineten and some of the hardware we provide to our clients to run these applications. This position may require independent work, sharing information and assisting others with work activities.

**Major Duties and Responsibilities:**

- Provide exceptional customer service in person, via phone, chat and email as appropriate
- Resolve help desk issues including troubleshooting hardware and application issues
- Action change requests to update client configurations on our various applications
- Perform user administration duties
- Work closely with account managers to achieve your goals. This role will require interacting with multiple internal and external stakeholders daily. Your ability to prioritise your own workload and get what you need from others is key!
- Monitor system operations/performance and troubleshoot problems.
- Develop support plan to prioritize and resolve multiple issues
- Maintain daily logs of operational issues and maintenance activities.
- Contribute to business meetings, report on issue status and to company-wide strategy and planning...

**Key Skills & Competencies Required:**

**Essential:**

- Ample and proven experience in a Technical Support role 
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
- Great people skills
- Good analytical thinker and problem solver
- Ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks accordingly
- Must be able to meet deadlines and perform under pressure
- Calm, polite, and professional behavior.
- Reliable and self-motivated.

**Desirable:**

- Experience in the ecommerce and/or logistics industries

**Who are Lineten**

We are a leading on-demand delivery platform, which is the future of the logistics industry. We currently have 50 employees, and having just gone through Series A funding, we are now accelerating our growth world-wide. Even though we are currently small, we have an impressive list of clients such as Farfetch, Krispy Kreme and Five Guys, to name but a few.

**Perks on offer**

- Individual £2000 training budget per annum
- £100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
- Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
- Healthcare will be launched within the next 3 months
- Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
- Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
- Have a dog? Dogs are our friends, please bring them in
- Onsite meditation/sleep room
- Onsite creche and babysitting service
- Onsite sports therapist
- Onsite games room
- Onsite free drinks every Thursday
- Discounts to local businesses services
- Opportunities to work abroad longer term

Be part of something big. We’re here to change things and want to make sure we develop our people along the way.

jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
We are seeking a Business Development Manager to help us continue to dominate one of the most buoyant, fast-growing industries, that is changing the world and the speed in which we receive items. 

**About Us**

With people all over the world self-isolating, working from home, exercising various forms of social distancing, businesses across many verticals need to come up with immediate, cost-effective, ways of delivering their offering to the customer.

LineTen’s delivery logistics platform supports both large enterprises and mid-size businesses, enabling them to seamlessly manage the large influx of home delivery demand amid the Coronavirus outbreak. Supporting grocery and hospitality chains as well as pharmacies, LineTen’s platform ensures all items are received on time and most importantly, by those most vulnerable. Though LineTen is no one-trick pony, our platform is the leading integration hub between POS, eCommerce platforms and delivery companies globally. You name it – we deliver.

**Role of SAAS, Business Development Manager**

The role will be split 80% New Business Development and 20% Account Management. It's imperative that you have excellent organizational skills and great attention to detail, due to the nature of the role. We offer uncapped commission opportunities and there is the opportunity to double your salary as well as gain equity or stock options. You will be working from home for the next 6 months until we open the office in Austin, so you must also be self-motivated and driven. 

We will be rapidly growing the Austin office, and as you will be the first employee based there, that means fantastic career development opportunities. 

**Responsibilities**

* Managing the full sales cycle of Mid-Enterprise customers (with some SME's)
* Generating new business with prospective clients in global markets.
* Educating new clients on LineTen’s offering, USPs and strengths.
* Engaging with prospective customers in a consultative sales way.
* Establishing strong client relations and creating solutions for clients.

**Skills / Experience Requirements**

* 2+yrs experience in selling a SAAS product (e-commerce or API experience will also be considered)
* Must have managed the full sales cycle autonomously
* Experience in the logistics delivery / last mile an advantage but not essential.
* Solid sales qualification experience, utilising a consultative mindset.
* Exceptional interpersonal communication and presentation skills.
* Outgoing, positive and energetic personality.
* Self-motivated and independent.
* Flexibility – ability to travel
* Experienced in enterprise sales methodologies, working with CRM systems for reporting, forecasting and pipeline management.

**Perks on offer**

* Basic $55-65,000 per annum
* Uncapped sales commissions
* Equity or stock options (in time)
* Individual $1500 training budget per annum
* $100 to spend on business books per annum
* Flexible working environment

Lineten is rapidly growing and we need ambitious, driven individuals to help us disrupt the logistics industry and take us to the next level. Fast growth, means excellent career development opportunities for individuals who join us now.

Be part of something big. We're here to change things and want to make sure we develop our people along the way

jobs.title: Head of Marketing
jobs.description:
**Head of Marketing/Marketing Manager**

LineTen is growing and we are now seeking our first Head of Marketing. This is a unique opportunity to build a marketing strategy and team from scratch in a fast-paced environment.

LineTen is on a mission to crack the code on urban delivery. By leading with our values and putting carrier partners first, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. LineTen is a new approach to delivery with a free carrier API and an operations management platform for shippers; we are building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

We are already working with the likes of Farfetch and Nandos as well as other major brands and we are now seeking a market leader, to help take us to the next level globally.

**Head of Marketing Responsibilities**

- Own the company’s branding and global marketing activities.
- Translate the broader strategy into industry-leading marketing campaigns.
- Own and drive marketing KPIs, including lead generation and sales aiding.
- Lead multi-channel marketing campaigns including paid, owned, and earned media.
- Partner with our cross-functional teams to build plans and deliver on content and collateral necessary to achieve our sales targets and align to company messaging and product positioning.
- Oversee all marketing communications, content, and plans for industry trade shows and events.  

**Skills / Experience Requirements**

- 5+ years’ experience as Director/VP in global marketing for B2B enterprise technology organisation.
- Ideally will have worked for a start-up previously but not essential
- Proven track record of successfully launching and scaling marketing campaigns cost-effectively with clear ROI focused metrics. 
- Experience in overseeing lead generation efforts, including paid, owned and earned media. Experience working with large enterprise customers.
- Experience building messaging and brand identity for a high tech company.
- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
- Bachelor's degree required; MBA highly preferred.

**Perks on offer**

- Individual £2000 training budget per annum
- £100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Pension scheme
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
- Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
- Healthcare will be launched within the next 3 months
- Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
- Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
- Have a dog? Dogs are our friends, please bring them in
- Onsite meditation/sleep room
- Onsite creche and babysitting service
- Onsite sports therapist
- Onsite games room
- Onsite free drinks every Thursday
- Discounts to local businesses services
- Opportunities to work abroad longer term

jobs.title: Product Manager/Owner
jobs.description:
**Product Owner**

**What we do:**

Lineten is on a mission to crack the code on urban delivery. By leading with our values and putting carrier partners first, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. Lineten is a new approach to delivery with a free carrier API and an operations management platform for shippers, we’re building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

**What to expect:**

As a Product Owner at Lineten you will work hand-in-hand with product management, designers and engineers, to refine and execute our core product roadmap for acquisition, on-boarding, retention - anything related to bringing Lineten to new carrier and shipper opportunities. In this role, you will:

- Develop on a product vision with the product team while coordinating awareness & execution across multiple functions.
- Order and manage the product feature backlog in order to maximise the value of what the development team is working on.
- Leads the planning of the product release plans and elaborate on user stories.
- Lead scrum teams to deliver prioritised roadmap items in an agile, data-driven way.
- Be hands on and take ownership for business metrics and product KPIs and play a pivotal role in bringing all stakeholders onboard - from release planning to internal sales and support demos.
- Actively mitigate impediments impacting successful team completion of release/sprint goals.

**Requirements:**

- You will have been a Product Owner or in a similar position previously. You will have a background in Product Management and have a passion for Technology, Data and Design.
- 3+ years’ experience in a start-up or similar where the core of the business was a technical product.
- Spent time in different start-ups / tech businesses working on delivering integrated product
- Experiences across web, mobile (iOS, Android), and even paid channels
- Strong technical skills and self-reliance in extracting, cleaning and analysing data, working closely
- with technical teams.
- All over agile methodologies – Scrum and Kanban – more in practice than textbook
- Fluent with Jira, ServiceDesk – ability to configure and setup as required by the business
- A highly structured individual who can summarise and simplify customer problems/business
- challenges
- An innate ability to listen and identify what other people find important
- Ability to remain calm under pressure – patient, empathetic and with a positive mindset
- Great communication skills – able to explain complex information in a simple and easy to
- understand way. Elaborate on user stories.
- An appetite to develop a deep understanding of Linetens product portfolio, client’s technology
- profiles and carrier-partner’s capabilities and limitations.

**Desirable:**

- You’ll have experience both client-side and agency-side and you enjoy working in a complex and technical industry.
- Experience with testing across all possible and meaningful opportunities – creatives, messaging, audiences, user stories, prioritisation
- Experience with creative production / you may be hands-on with design tools yourself or are comfortable working with designers
- Experience with data-driven segmentation, targeting and a/b testing, analytics and BI tools

**Perks on offer**

- Individual £2000 training budget per annum
- £100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
- Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
- Healthcare will be launched within the next 3 months
- Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
- Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
- Have a dog? Dogs are our friends, you’re more than welcome to bring yours in
- Onsite meditation/sleep room
- Onsite creche and babysitting service
- Onsite sports therapist
- Onsite games room
- Onsite free drinks every Thursday
- Discounts to local businesses services
- Opportunities to work abroad longer term

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.description:
Due to further expansion, we are seeking a Project Manager to help us to continue to dominate one of the most buoyant, fastest-growing industries, that is changing the world and the speed of which we receive items.

LineTen is on a mission to crack the code on urban delivery. By leading with our values and putting carrier partners first, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. LineTen is a new approach to delivery with a free carrier API and an operations management platform for shippers. We're building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

Being a project manager at Lineten will put you right at the heart of the company, having contact with key internal technical stakeholders, leading external workshops and delivering customer facing projects. You will be in charge of projects that will have direct effect on the company future and standing.

**What you will be doing**

- Running projects to PMP, PRINCE2 and Agile frameworks and methodologies
- Getting the best from a varied and diverse project team ensuring the best for our customers
- Managing Client expectations and delivering the highest quality products and business solutions
- Advancing the Lineten brand by providing an excellent service to our partners, customers and internal teams.
- Managing technical projects to solve to business problems (internal and external workstreams) across the lineten portfolio.
- Quality management interacting with the development team to ensure Lineten are producing quality products that are well designed and fit for purpose when delivered to the end customer / user.
- This role will require interacting with multiple internal and external stakeholders on a daily basis. Ability to prioritise workload and get what you need from key stakeholders
- Contribute to company-wide strategy and planning.

**Requirements**

- Minimum 3 years project management work experience, with at least 2 years in a IT software environment
- Confident in MS PROJECT 
- Good understanding of Agile and Waterfall project methodologies. 
- Experience of RAID Logs
- Confident and have experience of interacting with external clients
- Capturing high level business requirements and translating them into project scope and work-packages, being accountable for their delivery on time
- Ability to translate business requirements into a solid project plan and scope document
- The get up and go drive required to work in a start-up environment.
- Excellent stakeholder management
- Eligible to work in the UK
- Willingness to travel with the role
- Someone who wants to thrive in a fast-paced start-up and are able to work in a high-pressure environment 
- Ability to think outside the box and contribute to wider strategic decisions
- Positive and proactive nature, ready to get things done
- Strong organisational and communication skills 
- Entrepreneurial mind-set, willing to get your hands dirty
- To be tech savvy 

**Perks on offer**

- Individual £2000 training budget per annum
- £100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
- Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
- Healthcare will be launched within the next 3 months
- Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
- Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
- Have a dog? We’re a dog-friendly office, You're more than welcome to bring yours in 
- Onsite meditation/sleep room
- Onsite creche and babysitting service
- Onsite sports therapist
- Onsite games room
- Onsite free drinks every Thursday
- Discounts to local businesses services
- Opportunities to work abroad longer term

Lineten is rapidly growing and we need ambitious, driven individuals to help us disrupt the logistics industry and take us to the next level. Fast growth, means excellent career development opportunities for individuals who join us now.

Be part of something big. We're here to change things and want to make sure we develop our people along the way.

  • The get up and go drive required to work in a start-up environment.
  • Excellent stakeholder management
  • Eligible to work in the UK
  • Willingness to travel with the role
  • Someone who wants to thrive in a fast-paced start-up and are able to work in a high-pressure environment
  • Ability to think outside the box and contribute to wider strategic decisions
  • Positive and proactive nature, ready to get things done
  • Strong organisational and communication skills
  • Entrepreneurial mind-set, willing to get your hands dirty
  • To be tech savvy

Perks on offer

  • Individual £2000 training budget per annum
  • £100 to spend on business books per annum
  • Flexible working environment
  • Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
  • Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
  • Healthcare will be launched within the next 3 months
  • Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
  • Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
  • Have a dog? We’re a dog-friendly office, You're more than welcome to bring yours in
  • Onsite meditation/sleep room
  • Onsite creche and babysitting service
  • Onsite sports therapist
  • Onsite games room
  • Onsite free drinks every Thursday
  • Discounts to local businesses services
  • Opportunities to work abroad longer term

Lineten is rapidly growing and we need ambitious, driven individuals to help us disrupt the logistics industry and take us to the next level. Fast growth, means excellent career development opportunities for individuals who join us now.

Be part of something big. We're here to change things and want to make sure we develop our people along the way.

jobs.title: QA Analyst
jobs.description:
Due to further expansion, we are seeking a QA Tester to help us to continue to dominate one of the most buoyant, fastest-growing industries, that is changing the world and the speed of which we receive items.

LineTen is on a mission to crack the code on urban delivery. By leading with our values and putting carrier partners first, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. LineTen is a new approach to delivery with a free carrier API and an operations management platform for shippers. We're building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

**QA Analyst**

As a Technical QA Analyst, you will be responsible for testing releases of functionality to support the roll-out of features across cross-functional teams in the company to launch best in class delivery applications. You will work directly with Developers, QA Team, Product Owners and Technical managers to ensure quality development and quality of our applications and platforms.

**Responsibilities**

· Pick up things quickly, work well within a team, and manage your workload.

· Responsible for creating test artifacts (e.g. Test plans / Test closure reports)

· Responsible for designing testing scenarios using TDD/BDD techniques,

· Run Test executions and creating defects tickets where necessary.

· Attend daily scrums & contribute to sprint planning

· You will be involved in the identification, debugging, planning, creating and executing manual tests using TestRail

· Will be working on Cross-functional areas and on multiple products

· Working closely with developers and product owners, understand key issues are identified, recorded and tracked in a timely manner using JIRA

· You will be working in an Agile Scrum manner with CI/CD forming a key part of the Agile Scrum team.

· Participate in Continuous QA improvement Process

**Essential Experiences**

· Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes

· Proven ability to grasp complex product(s) setup and functionality quickly.

· Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases

· Testing complex web applications both from a UI and API perspective.

· Previously worked with project tracking tools such as JIRA.

· Strong experience of Web Testing, Integration testing, Functional testing, Exploratory testing and Regression testing

· Development of robust processes that ensure test scripts have sufficient coverage to ensure quality deliverables are released in a repeatable and confident manner.

· Knowledge of working in TDD/BDD techniques using Cucumber.

· Previously worked with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery tools

· Working knowledge of Restful APIs (editing payloads for integration/exploratory testing), JSON, JavaScript, HTML and be proficient using API tools like Insomnia, Postman or similar.

· Experience in coordinating UAT and working with external clients/providers to ensure the accuracy of test scenario execution.

**Personal Skills**

· Attention to detail and an ability to communicate detailed technical issues to Development and to the internal business/ project team and Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills

· A highly-motivated individual with well-developed interpersonal skills

· Able to work on own and also fit in as a team

· Ability to work in and develop processes to ensure efficient operation of the team.

· Demonstrate the ability to change direction and re-prioritise in a fast-paced team environment.

· Effective interpersonal skills and a proven ability to collaborate with all stakeholders

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

**Perks on offer**

- Individual £2000 training budget per annum
- £100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
- Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
- Healthcare will be launched within the next 3 months
- Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
- Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
- Have a dog? We’re a dog-friendly office, You're more than welcome to bring yours in 
- Onsite meditation/sleep room
- Onsite creche and babysitting service
- Onsite sports therapist
- Onsite games room
- Onsite free drinks every Thursday
- Discounts to local businesses services
- Opportunities to work abroad longer term

Lineten is rapidly growing and we need ambitious, driven individuals to help us disrupt the logistics industry and take us to the next level. Fast growth, means excellent career development opportunities for individuals who join us now.

Be part of something big. We're here to change things and want to make sure we develop our people along the way.

jobs.title: Technical Pre-Sales Engineer
jobs.description:
Due to further expansion, we are seeking a Technical Pre-Sales Engineer to help us to continue to dominate one of the most buoyant, fastest-growing industries, that is changing the world and the speed of which we receive items.

LineTen is on a mission to crack the code on urban delivery. By leading with our values and putting carrier partners first, we are paving the way for better delivery experiences. LineTen is a new approach to delivery with a free carrier API and an operations management platform for shippers. We're building the first global data-driven last-mile network that has the potential to solve industry-wide problems.

**Description**

The Technical Pre-Sales Engineer collaborates with sales, service, product, and development resources to ensure proposed projects include technical solutions that address customer needs, accurately represent the current business offering and are appropriately supported by key customer technical decision-makers. The Technical Pre-Sales Engineer is the technical go-to person for the development, sales department and all stakeholders during the installation and pilot phases of a project.

The role will require excellent communication and influencing skills, as you will be required to work with the Enterprise Architects, Domain Architects, Projects Managers and Heads of Departments within IT and client businesses.

**Responsibilities**

- Effectively qualifies all technical aspects of an opportunity
- Addresses and responds to prospect requests and product enhancements as needed
- Secures input from all necessary solution stakeholders within the customer firm. Adapts solutions, as necessary, to ensure appropriate support.
- Develop solution design assessments based on current company offering
- Develops solutions that enhance the project in anticipation of customer/industry needs
- Develops technical statement of work and solution architecture documents
- Input and Deliver the product(s) roadmap(s) working with Product Managers
- Presents complex technical information to non-technical audiences
- Presents customer needs to product, services and development
- Liaises with delivery as the in-field technical expert during pilots
- Provides all technical operational support and documentation during the installation and pilot phases of the project
- Provides coaching and professional development to team member sales associates in order to enhance their product knowledge, technical acumen, and technical sales skills
- Proactively scopes the technical solution required to address customer requirements, assesses customers met and unmet needs, and recommends solutions that optimize value for both the customer and the firm
- Secures from customer technical staff commitments needed to ensure a deal’s “technical close.

**Position Requirements**

- Significant experience working in a similar position, working with complex SaaS products 
- Preferably has worked in a start-up or equivalent fast paced and ambitious work environment
- A degree or professional qualification is required particularly in Software Engineering/Computer Science
-  Exceptional influencing skills, with the ability to advise and recommend with real credibility
- A record of experience that demonstrates capability and credibility 
- Architectural knowledge in Cloud services 
- Experience in managing the sales process, technical and commercial view, writing solution assessments, building technical statements of work, gathering new feature requirements from the customer
- Has a logical approach to delivery and working on client’s requirements, to realize how they align with the company’s current proposition
- Ability to present complex technical information to non-technical audiences
- Ability to present customer needs to product, services and development
- An understanding of logistics and delivery sector would be a big advantage
- Strong customer facing approach and presentation skills.
- Passionate and pragmatic about technology
- Creative and appreciative of emerging technologies
- Excellent communication skills and a team player

**Perks on offer**

- Individual £2000 training budget per annum
- £100 to spend on business books per annum
- Flexible working environment
- Ability to work from home 1 day a week (additional days to be agreed with your manager)
- Enhanced maternity/paternity pay
- Healthcare will be launched within the next 3 months
- Modern, funky offices based in White City/Shepherds Bush
- Safe bike storage and showers for those dedicated cyclists/runners
- Have a dog? We’re a dog-friendly office, you’re more than welcome to bring yours in 
- Onsite meditation/sleep room
- Onsite creche and babysitting service
- Onsite sports therapist
- Onsite games room
- Onsite free drinks every Thursday
- Discounts to local businesses services
- Opportunities to work abroad longer term

Lineten is rapidly growing and we need ambitious, driven individuals to help us disrupt the logistics industry and take us to the next level. Fast growth means excellent career development opportunities for individuals who join us now.

Be part of something big. We're here to change things and want to make sure we develop our people along the way.
